content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions, but here are some ways to utilize gaming walkthroughs and tutorials without relying on them too heavily:

1. Use walkthroughs as a supplementary guide. Instead of relying on them as the sole source of information, use them in conjunction with your own problem-solving skills and intuition.

2. Limit the use of walkthroughs to specific sections of the game. Only consult walkthroughs when you are completely stuck or when you've reached a particularly challenging section of the game.

3. Experiment and explore on your own. Try to solve puzzles and complete quests on your own before consulting a walkthrough.

4. Take breaks from the game. If you've been stuck on a particular level or puzzle for a while, taking a break from the game can help you come back to it with a fresh perspective.

5. Don't be afraid to ask for help from friends or online communities. Sometimes, getting advice from other players can be more helpful than relying on a walkthrough.
